name: ist1-5
body: |- wb(wcel(c0, ct1), wa(wcel(c0, ct0), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), ct1)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, ct1), wa(wcel(c0, ct0), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), ct1)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, ct1), wcel(c0, ct0))
-| wi(wbr(c0, chmph, cfv(ckq, c0)), wi(wcel(c0, ct1), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), ct1)))
-| wi(wbr(cfv(ckq, c0), chmph, c0), wi(wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), ct1), wcel(c0, ct1)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Fre ↔(c0 ∈ Kol2 ∧(KQ ` c0)∈ Fre))
⊣ (c0 ∈ Fre → c0 ∈ Kol2)
⊣ (c0[~ =](KQ ` c0)→(c0 ∈ Fre →(KQ ` c0)∈ Fre))
⊣ ((KQ ` c0)[~ =]c0 →((KQ ` c0)∈ Fre → c0 ∈ Fre))

comment: A topological space is T_1 iff it is both T_0 and R_0. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
